decision_conditions: <p>The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extensions hereby permitted shall match those used in the exterior of the existing building. The materials to be used in the construction of the modified outbuilding hereby permitted shall match those used in the exterior of the existing outbuilding.<br></p>
The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:&nbsp;<span style="line-height:normal">Existing and proposed ground floor; Existing and proposed 1<span style="font-size: 12pt;">st</span> floor plan; Existing and proposed front elevation; Existing and proposed rear elevation; Existing and proposed side elevation; Existing and proposed side elevation; Existing and proposed roof plan; Reasonable exemption statement; Flood Risk Assessment (Dated 26/09/2023); Proposed elevation of outbuilding;&nbsp;</span>

The window(s) in the first floor flank elevation(s) of the proposed development shall:
(a) be of purpose-made obscure glass,
(b) be permanently fixed closed below a height of 1.7m above finished floor level,
and shall thereafter be retained in that form.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s), other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.
description: Two storey side to rear extension; single storey rear extension; rooflights in front and rear roofslopes; external alterations (part demolition of detached garage and canopy at rear)
